comments:
Driver:  WTP 1.5 GM

If there's only stub servers runtime install, no server created, and the user chooses START on the service scale, a banner message is displayed to state that "Server has only stub runtimes associated with it so the server will not be created or started".  This is fine if the user only choose service side since the scale setting would be automatically set to DEPLOY by the wizard if there's only stub server.  However, if the user also choose to START on client scale, the user would get stuck on the proxy generation page and the console would have this error:

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

So when service side is set to lower than START, client side should be disabled.

ClientExtensionDefaultingCommand is updated to set install, start and test to false if there's only stub runtime.

We decided not to change the visual behaviour on the 1st page (i.e. clip what the user can enter on service or client side) but rather rely on the banner warning to indicate to the user that since there's only stub runtime, the server would not be created or started.

The fix has been committed and will be released later on today.
Released to HEAD and WTP 1.5.1 as v200608301709.  This will be in the 08/31 WTP 1.5.1 M-build.
